content: Intern tip: If your code works and you don’t know why… step away slowly and commit immediately.
Junior mistake: Fixing a bug by adding another bug that cancels it out.
Intern tip: Naming variables 'foo' and 'bar' will haunt you forever.
Junior dev mistake: Commenting out half the code instead of fixing it.
Intern mistake: Trying to fix production directly because 'it’s faster'.
lesson: Always test in a safe environment.

content: Beginners often forget semicolons and spend hours debugging.
Junior dev mistake: Using print statements for debugging instead of a proper debugger.
Intern mistake: Copy-pasting code without understanding it.
Junior mistake: Not committing often and losing progress.
Intern tip: Running `rm -rf /` without checking the directory… never again.
Junior dev mistake: Using global variables for everything.
Intern tip: Ignoring error messages because they look scary.
Junior mistake: Overengineering a simple function.
Intern tip: Forgetting to sanitize input data.
Junior dev mistake: Not writing tests and wondering why it breaks.
Intern mistake: Leaving console.log() in production code.
Junior mistake: Using magic numbers instead of constants.
Intern tip: Forgetting to push to Git before leaving.
Junior dev mistake: Overwriting master branch accidentally.
Intern mistake: Ignoring code reviews because 'they are long'.
Junior mistake: Mixing tabs and spaces causing formatting chaos.
Intern tip: Trying to memorize every API method at once.
Junior dev mistake: Hardcoding credentials in the code.
Intern mistake: Ignoring merge conflicts hoping they disappear.
Junior mistake: Not using version control at all.
Intern tip: Forgetting to refresh the browser and thinking code doesn’t work.
Junior dev mistake: Ignoring security best practices.
Intern mistake: Trying to optimize prematurely before code works.
Junior mistake: Using copy-paste solutions from StackOverflow blindly.
Intern tip: Forgetting to check null or undefined values.
Junior dev mistake: Ignoring browser console warnings.
Intern mistake: Not reading commit messages, wondering what changed.
Junior mistake: Using one-liner hacks instead of readable code.
Intern tip: Forgetting to check logs for errors.
Junior dev mistake: Over-commenting obvious code.
Intern mistake: Using outdated libraries without checking.
Junior mistake: Ignoring code style conventions.
Intern tip: Deleting files randomly to 'clean up'.
Junior dev mistake: Using too many nested loops unnecessarily.
Intern mistake: Forgetting to handle exceptions.
Junior mistake: Ignoring performance implications of code.
Intern tip: Relying on the IDE to catch all mistakes.
Junior dev mistake: Refactoring in production without tests.
Intern mistake: Forgetting to close database connections.
Junior mistake: Overusing inheritance instead of composition.
Intern tip: Ignoring accessibility issues in UI.
Junior dev mistake: Not using caching for repeated heavy operations.
Intern mistake: Trying to do everything in one commit.
Junior mistake: Not documenting functions for team members.
Intern tip: Ignoring the README file entirely.
